fact: Australia is the only country that is also a continent.
interestingFact: There are more kangaroos than people in Australia.

fact: Brazil is home to 60% of the Amazon Rainforest.
interestingFact: They have an entire town painted in blue called Chefchaouen.

fact: Chile is home to the world’s driest desert: the Atacama Desert.
interestingFact: In some parts of Chile, it hasn’t rained for hundreds of years.

fact: Ancient Egyptians invented toothpaste around 5000 BC.
interestingFact: The Great Pyramid of Giza can focus electromagnetic energy.

fact: France is the most visited country in the world.
interestingFact: There's only one stop sign in the entire city of Paris.

fact: Iceland is powered almost entirely by renewable energy.
interestingFact: There are no mosquitoes in Iceland.

fact: India is the world's largest democracy.
interestingFact: The Kumbh Mela gathering is so large, it can be seen from space.
Vending machines in Japan sell everything from hot meals to umbrellas.

fact: Nepal is home to 8 of the world's 10 highest mountains, including Mount Everest.
interestingFact: It’s the only country in the world that doesn’t have a rectangular flag.

fact: There are more sheep than people in New Zealand.
interestingFact: It was the first country to give women the right to vote in 1893.

fact: Norway gets almost all its electricity from hydropower.
interestingFact: It’s legal to camp almost anywhere in nature in Norway due to “freedom to roam” laws.

fact: South Africa has three capital cities.
interestingFact: It's the only country to have hosted the soccer, cricket, and rugby world cups.

fact: South Korea has one of the fastest internet speeds in the world.
interestingFact: They celebrate a special holiday called ‘Pepero Day’ with cookie sticks.

fact: Switzerland is famous for being neutral in international conflicts.
interestingFact: It has no official head of state and rotates its presidency annually.

fact: Thailand is the only Southeast Asian country never colonized by a European power.
interestingFact: It holds the record for the world’s longest place name – the full ceremonial name of Bangkok.
